title: NBA Daily News Digest
subtitle: February 09, 2026 - Trade Deadline Fallout & Star Performances

items.headline: Blockbuster Deal: Harden to Cavaliers, Garland to Clippers!
items.summary: In a seismic move as the NBA trade deadline neared, James Harden has been traded to the Cleveland Cavaliers in exchange for Cavs star Darius Garland and a second-round draft pick. This move aims to bolster Cleveland's offensive firepower alongside Donovan Mitchell, while the Clippers look to the future with the 26-year-old Garland.

items.headline: Historic All-Star Appearance: Deni Avdija Joined by Alperen Sengun!
items.summary: Deni Avdija makes history as the first Israeli player selected for the NBA All-Star Game. He will be joined by Houston Rockets' Turkish center Alperen Şengün, who replaces an injured Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, marking a unique and unprecedented Israeli-Turkish collaboration on the All-Star stage.

items.headline: Surprise Return: Lillard to Compete in Three-Point Contest Despite Injury!
items.summary: Portland's Damian Lillard, who has been sidelined all season recovering from a torn left Achilles tendon, will make a surprising return to compete in next weekend's NBA Three-Point Contest. A two-time champion, Lillard seeks to match the record of three titles.

items.headline: Leonard's 41 Puts Clippers Over Timberwolves
items.summary: Kawhi Leonard exploded for 41 points and grabbed eight rebounds, leading the Los Angeles Clippers to a dominant 115-96 victory over the struggling Minnesota Timberwolves.

items.headline: Raptors Down Pacers, Furphy Exits Injured
items.summary: The Toronto Raptors defeated the Indiana Pacers 122-104. Scottie Barnes led the Raptors with 25 points and 14 rebounds, while RJ Barrett added 20. Pacers' rookie Johnny Furphy left the game with a knee injury.

items.headline: Heat Cruise Past Wizards
items.summary: The Miami Heat secured a decisive 132-101 win over the Washington Wizards. Bam Adebayo chipped in 22 points, and Norman Powell added 21 for Miami.

items.headline: Knicks Defeat Celtics in Low-Scoring Affair
items.summary: The New York Knicks beat the Boston Celtics 107-80. Josh Hart contributed 19 points for New York, and Jose Alvarado had 12 in his Knicks debut. Jaylen Brown led Boston with 26 points.

items.headline: Embiid, Maxey Lead 76ers Past Suns
items.summary: Joel Embiid's 33 points and 9 rebounds, along with Tyrese Maxey's 29 points and 9 rebounds, propelled the Philadelphia 76ers to a 109-103 victory over the Phoenix Suns.

items.headline: Trail Blazers Edge Grizzlies
items.summary: The Portland Trail Blazers secured their second straight win, defeating the Memphis Grizzlies 122-115. Jeremy Grant was the leading scorer for Portland.

items.headline: Kawhi Leonard Dominates with 41 Points
items.statContext: LAC F Kawhi Leonard led the Clippers with a season-high 41 points, adding 8 rebounds and 4 steals in their victory over the Timberwolves.

items.headline: Embiid's Near Double-Double Powers 76ers
items.statContext: PHI C Joel Embiid posted an impressive 33 points and 9 rebounds in the 76ers' win against the Suns.

items.headline: Maxey Continues Hot Streak with 29 Points
items.statContext: PHI G Tyrese Maxey contributed significantly with 29 points and 9 rebounds in Philadelphia's victory.

items.headline: Barnes Double-Double Leads Raptors
items.statContext: TOR F Scottie Barnes recorded a strong double-double with 25 points and 14 rebounds in the Raptors' win over the Pacers.

items.headline: LeBron Logs Another Double-Double
items.statContext: LAL F LeBron James delivered 20 points and 10 assists in the Lakers' contest.

items.headline: Trade Deadline Frenzy: More Deals Shake Up League
items.summary: Beyond the Harden-Garland swap, the trade market was bustling. Jaren Jackson Jr. is reportedly headed to the Utah Jazz from Memphis, Nikola Vucevic to the Celtics from the Bulls, and Chris Paul was part of a three-team deal sending him to Toronto. The Knicks acquired Jose Alvarado from New Orleans, and the Thunder landed Jared McCain from Philadelphia.

items.headline: Luka Doncic Sidelined with Hamstring Injury
items.summary: Lakers superstar Luka Doncic is out for Monday's game against the Oklahoma City Thunder due to a hamstring injury sustained recently. Doncic leads the league, averaging 32.8 points per game.

items.headline: Rookie Johnny Furphy Suffers Knee Injury
items.summary: Indiana Pacers rookie Johnny Furphy exited Monday's game against the Raptors with a right knee injury after an awkward landing. He was taken to the locker room in a wheelchair, and his status remains unclear pending further testing.

items.headline: Milwaukee Bucks Sign Cam Thomas
items.summary: The Milwaukee Bucks have announced the signing of guard Cam Thomas, who was recently waived by the Brooklyn Nets. Thomas averaged 15.6 points in 24 games this season for Brooklyn.

items.headline: Tonight's Key Matchups
items.summary: Tonight's NBA action features the Philadelphia 76ers visiting Deni Avdija and the Portland Trail Blazers at 10:00 PM ET. Additionally, a Peacock doubleheader showcases the Milwaukee Bucks against the Orlando Magic at 7:30 PM ET, followed by the Oklahoma City Thunder facing the Los Angeles Lakers at 10:00 PM ET. The Charlotte Hornets also host the Detroit Pistons at 7:00 PM ET.
